newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.African Reserve Bank offering liquidity - dealers.
newsitem.headline: S.African Reserve Bank offering liquidity - dealers.

text.p: The South African Reserve Bank was offering liquidity in the foreign exchange market early on Tuesday to smooth the rand after it fell to a fresh two-month, dealers said.
"He seems to be providing some liquidity, supplying dollars to the market," said one dealer as the currency recovered from a low of 4.5765 bid against the dollar to 4.5700.
However, other dealers said they had not seen a central bank presence in early dealings.
The rand touched an all-time low of 4.59 against the U.S. dollar on August 19.
Some dealers said Reserve Bank action would hold the key to the market on Tuesday with a lack of decisive action possibly fuelling a descent to 4.60.
